title: multiple owncloud servers - one machine to rule them all
body:
i know we've seen people poopoo the multiple owncloud server issue before. but the reality is that on a personal level owncloud is great. on a corporate level, owncloud is great. i use the personal owncloud to store my personal data at home. i am the corporate administrator for the corporate owncloud. and never the two shall meet.

now, i know there was talk about using vm's to handle this situation, but even this has proved untenable.

here is the issue. if the vm is not running, nothing is syncing. but the files are still accessible in the host. which is normal. you would expect to get to your files all the time. 

since the phone clients allow me to switch between accounts, and the desktop clients provide sync by folder, it does not follow for me that we cannot associate a two level hierarchy which would simply synchronize individual folders any given server to a single folder on the client machine. there is no need to sync across the servers. there would be no overlap. but at it's core, the sync would always work for as many organizations as one belongs to.

the secondary problem here is that under win64, moving files is not detected properly, so when the sync starts up again, it redownloads all the moved files even when the move is done with the vm running. this is not the problem. this is simply the artifact of needing multiple owncloud clients running in multiple environments. if there was one client and this was ocurring, i would consider this a primary fault.

but the bottom line here is that to assume that any one person has only one instance of owncloud connected defeats the purpose of owncloud - your data under your control.
